usefulItems: baking sheets, parchment paper, small ramekins, piping bags, silicone mat, cookie cutters, wire rack, cling wrap, airtight container, oven
title: Sugar Cookies

ingredients.content: 6 oz unsalted butter, chilled, diced (½ in.)
12 oz all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
1 egg white, from a large pasteurized egg
food coloring (e.g., red, green, silver, blue, gold)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add butter, egg, vanilla, flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt and mix <b>8 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>.

Transfer to a lightly floured silicone mat, top dough with a sheet of cling wrap and roll out to ¼ inch thickness. Cut shapes (approx. 3-4 in. wide) with cookie cutters. Place onto prepared baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes (350°F) until slightly golden. Let cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place 7 oz sugar into mixing bowl and grind <b>1 min/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and aside.
Place remaining 7 oz of sugar into mixing bowl and grind <b>1 min/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved ground sugar, egg white and lemon juice and mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>. Divide icing into small ramekins and add food coloring, mix through until completely emulsified and desired colors are achieved. Transfer to piping bags and decorate cookies as desired. Garnish with sprinkles or candy. Allow to dry completely before serving or storing in an airtight container.

hintsAndTricks: Pasteurized egg white can be replaced with unpasteurized egg white or 5 tbsp of meringue powder in royal icing.
